description: System Security Plan (SSP) document including all required sections per FedRAMP High Baseline requirements
Current system and information integrity policy and procedures, including review and update dates
Vulnerability scanning reports and flaw remediation tracking records for the past 90 days
Evidence of security-relevant software and firmware updates installed within 30 days of release
Configuration management documentation showing integration of flaw remediation processes
Malicious code protection mechanism configuration documentation, including signature-based and non-signature-based technologies
Malicious code scanning logs showing weekly scans and real-time scanning at endpoints and network entry/exit points
Alert notifications sent to administrators in response to malicious code detection
System monitoring objectives and monitoring device deployment architecture diagrams
Intrusion detection and prevention system (IDS/IPS) configuration and alert logs
Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system configuration and real-time analysis reports
Network traffic monitoring logs for inbound and outbound communications showing continuous monitoring
System-generated security alerts and notifications sent to designated personnel
Wireless intrusion detection system configuration and scanning reports
Evidence of monitoring information correlation across multiple security tools
Host-based monitoring mechanisms configuration on servers, workstations, and mobile devices
US-CERT and CISA security alerts, advisories, and directives received and disseminated in the past year
CISA Emergency and Binding Operational Directives compliance status documentation
Security directive implementation records showing compliance within established timeframes
Security and privacy function verification test results performed at system startup/restart and monthly
Software, firmware, and information integrity verification tool configuration and scan results
Integrity check logs performed at least monthly and during security-relevant events
Automated notifications of integrity violations sent to ISSO and security personnel
Cryptographic code authentication mechanisms for software and firmware components
Spam protection mechanism configuration at system entry and exit points
DMARC configuration documentation for outgoing email domains (if applicable)
Information input validation procedures and exception documentation
Error handling procedures and error message logs showing restricted disclosure
Information management and retention schedules in accordance with NARA requirements
Memory protection controls documentation including data execution prevention and address space layout randomization
Services, ports, and protocols inventory with purpose and authorized users
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for privileged and non-privileged functions
System owner and ISSO contact information and organizational chart
FedRAMP Package ID and authorization documentation
Incident response plan and incident reporting procedures aligned with US-CERT guidelines
